result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. 
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
No association with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license. 
Not to drive with any alcohol/ illegal drugs in system. 
Daily PBT's at CHSO or Sober Link Device or Enroll & Actively participate in IDIP. May submit to daily PBT's
at Stanley Police Department or any other police department if in close proximity.  Defendant to make arrangements 
and abide by all their requirements.

Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant CHRISTOPHER B KUNZE appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder appeared by video for CHRISTOPHER B KUNZE.
